attributes.action: Animal welfare charities to receive funding from the £750 million Gov package
attributes.additional_details:
Covid-19 has a devastating effect on animal charities in the UK. 
Due to government restrictions shelters and sanctuaries have been forced to close. Their ability to fundraise and collect donations has been greatly effected. Many have reported a decline in funding due to shop closures. 
Animal charities are responsible for collecting animals from the homes of people who've been admitted to hospital with Covid-19, who may not have anyone else to care for them.
attributes.background: On 8 April the Chancellor announced charities across the UK will receive a £750 million package of support to ensure they can continue their vital work during the coronavirus outbreak. The announcement did not mention if animal charities will be included. Animal charities need funding urgently.
